Name: Introduction to Light: The Physics of Light, Vision, and Color (Dover Books on Physics)

ReviewList.Text: Book is a little dated. It deserves to be read carefully since some areas are ambiguous. Author is careful not to over-reach. Would like to have seen more on the visible spectrum and how the eyes see color.
I did not buy this book, I leafed through it at the bookstore. It is in all black and white; no color! A book whose topic is the physics of light and color should contain color illustrations.
